channel.title: Procedural Visuality
channel.description: This dissertation project inquires the complex interplay of code and visuality in digital games. The research focus lies on early games attributed to Switzerland and their visuality, mainly the the image seen on screen.

item.title: Corpus, corpora and visual methodologies
item.description: Since I am the graphics-person, I'm also collecting images, of course. I try to do as many screenshots as necessary and scrape the internet for additional material.

item.title: Looking back at the Games & Literature Conference
item.description: The Games & Literature conference at the German Literature Archive in Marbach was intense. I counted 30 talks on the program, from which I attended 25 and gave one together with Eugen Pfister.

item.title: Diss-Storming Session
item.description: I have a basic assumption after a rather broad reading of texts. There seems to be an invisible rift between the research image of the video game and its material base, a border between the visuality and technology.

item.title: It's summer time: readings, corpora and other updates
item.description: It's summer and I can finally concentrate on all things related to my dissertation project. On the agenda is playing video games, working on a representation of masculinity in old games' subproject, working on my Image Corpus, and, of course, getting some reading is done.

item.title: Autumn – Mid-Semester
item.description: As expected, the study semester is taking a toll on time, energy and focus. It seems easier, and more relevant, than last semester. Besides that, I feel that the productivity from the summer came to a halt.

item.title: Literature
item.description: After the wonderful kick-off, which cost me a lot of social energy (worth every unit), I got some input on literature.

item.title: Kick-off
item.description: Starting December 2022, I began with my literature review. Being only vaguely familiar with analyzing video games, that was an obvious way to start.

item.title: Images in Social Media Research
item.description: I took part in the online-workshop: Images in Social Media Research.

item.title: Close Reading the VICE Source Code
item.description: Today I'm attempting to close read the code base of the VICE emulator. I already made some attempts at this through going into the source code author's comments.

item.title: Emulation
item.description: The last two weeks I was playing a few video games by Golden Gate Crew as well as Linel. They were all developed and published for the Amiga system. In order to play them, I had to work with an emulator.

item.title: Post-Summer – Pre-semester
item.description: I was on a two weeks vacation in August and didn't care much about my journal. Still, a lot of things continued to become and manifest.

item.title: Memo on Videospiele by Jakob Birken
item.description: I've finished reading Jakob Birken's Videospiele and found it to be a good primer. Some interesting topics got touched, but never dug deep.

item.title: March Reflection on Dissertation Topic
item.description: Right now I do feel a bit lost with my dissertation. But I'm sure that's how it has to be right now. I had a meeting with my supervisor last week that was very giving in terms on how to go forwards. The most important take-away was, that I should speak to all my disciplines.
